page.title: 19Our Local Policeman
page.content: headquarters are at Easingwold, a small market town. He patrols the villages by car and on foot. He comes to our school to tell us about safety. He visits old people, attends to accidents and burglaries. Some of his work is connected with issuing licences to farmers before taking stock to market. The Parish Council receives complaints from villages and takes action when possible.It is responsible for the Playing Field and roads in this area.After discussion with the Parish Council North Sea Gas is now in use at Tollerton. The windmill in Tollerton is between 200 and 300 years old.Built by a Tollerton family,the mill was used until 1942.The mill has been converted into a house.Extensions have been built round the tower.
